title: Capital Gains Reform Act of 1997
content: Capital Gains Reform Act of 1997 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to revise rules concerning capital gain for taxpayers other than corporations to establish a new general rule which provides that if for any taxable year a taxpayer other than a corporation has a capital gain, 70 percent of such gain shall be a deduction from gross income. Reduces the alternative capital gain tax for corporations.
